details.title: COVID-19 UPDATES FROM OCTOBER 25
details.content:
West Bengal records over 4,000 cases amid Durga Puja festivities and more. Get all your updates from October 25 here.
(READ HERE)

details.title: Recovery rate in India touches 90 per cent
details.content:
• The coronavirus cases reported in India in a span of 24 hours remained below 55,000 for the third consecutive day on Sunday.
  • New fatalities recorded in a day dropped to 578 after almost three months, according to the Union Health Ministry’s data.
  • With this, the national recovery rate has risen to 90 per cent and case fatality rate stands at 1.51 per cent.
  • Country’s Covid-19 caseload mounted to 78,64,811 with 50,129 fresh infections being reported in a day, while the death toll climbed to 1,18,534 with 578 new fatalities, as per the data shared on October 25.

details.title: WATCH | Barack Obama slams Trump administration's COVID-19 response
Among top ten worst-hit states, Bengal yet to touch COVID-19 peak
details.content:
The Covid-19 pandemic is yet to peak in West Bengal, Delhi peaked twice in a span of 20 days while Tamil Nadu bucked the trend of cases not declining for a long time after peaking in July-end.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Global update | No news of COVID-19 death in Victoria
details.content:
No new #coronavirus cases or deaths reported in Australian state of Victoria, which has spent months under onerous restrictions after becoming the epicentre of the country's second wavehttps://t.co/ulgn1yG9TT pic.twitter.com/wOCqy1YfDb

— AFP news agency (@AFP) October 26, 2020

details.title: Politics over COVID-19 vaccine: Uddhav hits out at BJP on 'free vaccine' poll promise
details.content:
Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday slammed the BJP over its poll promise of free COVID-19 vaccine in Bihar, adding does that party think those from other states hail from Bangladesh or Kazakhstan.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Mizoram reports 46 new coronavirus cases in last 24 hours
details.content:
46 new #COVID19 cases reported in Mizoram, taking the total number of positive cases to 2,493 till date.

The number of active cases is at 290 while 2,203 people have been discharged so far.

No death reported in the state till date: Government of Mizoram pic.twitter.com/XNiI0Vk7q2

— ANI (@ANI) October 26, 2020

details.title: Global update | UK doctors demand free meals for kids as COVID-19 fuels hunger
details.content:
Pediatricians are urging the British government to reverse course and provide free meals for poor children during school holidays as the COVID-19 pandemic pushes more families into poverty.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

A view of a lunch box at the 'Pudding Pantry' which will be provided for free during half term for any child in need, who would normally get a free school lunch in Nottingham, UK. (Photo | AP)

details.title: COVID-19 vaccine storage issues could deprive three billion people of access
details.content:
Maintaining the cold chain for coronavirus vaccines won’t be easy even in the richest of countries, especially when it comes to those that require ultracold temperatures of around minus 70 degrees Celsius (minus 94 F).
Here is why the sotrage of vaccine could deprive billions of its access!
(READ REPORT HERE TO KNOW MORE)

Total 10,34,62,778 samples tested for #COVID19 up to 25th October. Of these 9,39,309 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) pic.twitter.com/nObiHxDE4E

— ANI (@ANI) October 26, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 dampens festive spirit at South Delhi's posh Defence Colony market
details.content:
However, with still two weeks left for Diwali, shop owners are hopeful that a good festive sale to tide over the losses which their businesses have suffered since the past few months.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Third phase trial of COVID-19 vaccine 'Covaxin' at IMS and SUM Hospital soon
details.content:
The third phase human trial of indigenously developed COVID-19 vaccine "Covaxin" will soon commerce at the Institute of Medical Sciences and SUM Hospital in Odisha.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 45,148 fresh cases push India’s Covid-19 tally above 79-lakh mark
Business update | Interest-on-interest waiver significant relief to Covid-hit borrowers
details.content:
After being pulled up by the Supreme Court, the Government last week finally announced a waiver of compound interest for those who opted for the six-month moratorium extended by the Reserve Bank of India. But, will you be eligible to take advantage of the interest waiver?
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 updates from Kerala
details.content:
The steady trend in #COVID19 deaths, #Kerala asks each peripheral #health institution to review the mapping of #elderly and severely comorbid #patients in their respective field areas. Symptom surveillance also to get strengthened @NewIndianXpress @xpresskerala #coronavirus

— Dileep V Kumar (@dileepvk_TNIE) October 26, 2020

details.title: With spike of 45,149 cases, India's COVID-19 tally reaches 79,09,960
details.content:
The number of total active COVID-19 cases stood at 6,53,717 after a decrease of 14,437 in the last 24 hours. Total cured cases stand at 71,37,229 with 59,105 new discharges in the last 24 hours.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 became 'syndemic' for chronic disease patients
details.content:
Scientists have assessed the synergistic impact of COVID-19 on people with non communicable diseases (NCDs) like diabetes in low and middle-income countries such as India, and found that there has never been a more dangerous time for them than the ongoing pandemic. 
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.content:
#Kerala releases its 3rd #COVID19Death Audit Report

-More deaths among males
-Comorbidities a major factor - 116 had #hypertension, 120 had #diabetes, 15 had #cancer & others

details.title: Global update | Will prolong the pandemic: WHO chief warns against 'COVID vaccine nationalism'
details.content:
Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said the only way to recover from the pandemic was together and by making sure poorer countries had fair access to a vaccine.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

Devotees maintaining social distance as they visit Bankey Bihari temple after its reopening, in Vrindavan.

(Photo | PTI)

details.title: Kerala update | COVID-19 positive cop from Idukki dies at Kottayam Medical College Hospital
details.content:
A police officer with the Thodupuzha police station in Kerala's Idukki district, who had tested positive for COVID-19, died at the Kottayam Medical College Hospital. The deceased identified as CK Raju, an additional SI, at the Thodupuzha police station.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Maharashtra deputy CM Ajit Pawar tests positive for Covid-19
details.content:
Maharashtra deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar has been tested as covid 19 positive, admitted in the breach candy hospital Mumbai. Ajit Pawar said he is fine , doing well and nothing to worry. @NewIndianXpress

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) October 26, 2020

details.title: Study reveals fear encourages social distancing during COVID-19 pandemic
details.content:
The researchers applied the regulatory focus theory, a persuasion theory in the field of psychology which focuses on framing the information either negatively or positively.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Telangana adds 582 cases to its COVID-19 tally
details.content:
Telangana recorded 582 #COVID19 cases, 1,432 recoveries and 4 deaths yesterday, taking total cases to 2,31,834 including 2,11,912 recoveries, 1,311 deaths and 18,611 active cases: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/YO4j0Mr2FX

details.title: Sports update | Ronaldinho tests positive for coronavirus
details.content:
Former Brazil footballer Ronaldinho on Sunday confirmed that he has tested positive for coronavirus.  Ronaldinho, who is self-isolating in Belo Horizonte, said he is fine and asymptomatic.
(Inputs from ANI)

(Photo | AP)

details.title: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar tests positive for COVID-19, hospitalised
details.content:
Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on Monday said he has tested positive for COVID-19 and is admitted in a hospital here on the advice of doctors.
In a message, Pawar said his health condition is fine.
"I have tested positive for COVID-19. My health condition is fine. As a precautionary measure I have admitted self to Breach Candy Hospital on the advice of doctors," the NCP leader said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: ‘Vidyarambham' is a tradition where children are introduced to reading and writing
details.content:
1500-2000 children used to attend 'Vidyarambham' every year but we restricted it less than 300 this year due to #COVID19. We are strictly following COVID protocols. Thermal checking being done at entry point, we are collecting details of the people: President of the temple Trust https://t.co/dc77at5HiE pic.twitter.com/hZocxLUgQX

— ANI (@ANI) October 26, 2020

details.title: Senior doctors of NDMC hospitals go on mass casual leave, threaten indefinite strike
details.content:
Senior doctors of North Corporation-run hospitals went on casual leave en masse on Monday as the crisis over pending salaries of medics of civic-run facilities deepened.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 'Low key' Dasara celebrations on last day amid COVID-19 restrictions in Mysuru

— ANI (@ANI) October 26, 2020

details.title: Large gatherings, no masks: COVID caution goes for toss in Bihar election heat
details.content:
The Election Commission had on October 21 directed Bihar's Chief Electoral Officer and district administrations to "invoke appropriate and relevant penal provisions" under the Disaster Management Act and the Indian Penal Code against candidates found violating its orders.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India reports less than 500 deaths in last 24 hours
details.content:
India’s case fatality rate lowest since 22nd March at 1.5%. Fourteen States/Union Territories have case fatality ratio less than 1%. Less than 500 deaths reported in the last 24 hours: Union Health Ministry (Representational Image)#COVID19 pic.twitter.com/BVUbwS2BFc

— ANI (@ANI) October 26, 2020

details.title: Resuming ‘mulaqat’, preparing sweets: Delhi jails look to return to normalcy step-by-step
details.content:
According to jail officials, Central Jail No 2 of Tihar and Jail No 14 of Mandoli, which house the bakeries, have gradually started increasing the quantity of sweets they prepare, like they used to before COVID-19 pandemic.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India to provide food aid to African countries
details.content: Government of India to provide 270 MT of food aid to Sudan, South Sudan, Djibouti and Eritrea, affected by natural calamities and COVID19 pandemic: Ministry of External Affairs

details.title: Chandigarh records 47 new cases
details.content: 47 new COVID-19 cases reported in Chandigarh in the last 24 hours. The total number of positive cases stands at 14,085 to date, with 633 active cases, 13,230 cured cases, and 222 deaths: Union Territory Health Department

details.title: Madhya Pradesh case tally
details.content:
Madhya Pradesh reports 720 new COVID-19 cases, 5 deaths and 1,095 recoveries today.

Total cases in the state rise to 1,67,969, with 2,890 deaths and 1,54,222 recoveries so far.

Active cases stand at 10,857

details.title: WATCH| Poor hygiene, water quality can lower COVID-19 fatality rate
Punjab case tally
details.content: Punjab reported 336 new COVID-19 cases and 8 deaths on 26th October. Total number of cases stand at 1,31,391 with 1,23,047 discharges, 4,219 active cases & 4,125 deaths: State Government

details.title: Maharashtra COVID tally
details.content:
Maharashtra reports 3,645 new COVID-19 cases, 9,905 recoveries and 84 deaths, as per their Public Health Department.

The COVID tally of the state rises to 16,48,665, with 14,70,660 recoveries and 43,348 deaths. Active cases 1,34,137

details.title: COVID-19 dampens Nepal's annual Dashain celebration
details.content: With Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli-led administration urging people to celebrate the festival in their homes, Mira Adhikari's family dropped the plan of visiting Tanahun, their ancestral home that is around 150 kilometers away from capital Kathmandu. (READ MORE)

details.title: Delhi reports 2,832 new cases
details.content: Delhi reports 2,832 new COVID-19 cases, 3,736 recoveries/discharges/migrations and 54 deaths in the last 24 hours. Total cases here rise to 3,59,488, including 3,27,390 recoveries/discharges/migrations and 6,312 deaths. Active cases 25,786: Delhi Government

details.title: Robot to run Covid testing machine in Dharwad's DIMHANS
details.content: The testing lab was set up at DIMHANS in April and it was the third centre in the North Karnataka region. The centre got established after the number of patients started increasing rapidly and it also eased pressure on the testing lab at Karnataka Institute of Medical Sciences. (READ MORE)

details.title: Tamil Nadu agriculture minister remains critically ill
details.content: Tamil Nadu Minister for Agriculture, R Doraikkannu, who is being treated for severe Covid-19 pneumonia in a private hospital in Chennai continues to be critically ill. (READ MORE)

details.title: Covid intensity subsides in Maharashtra, but Pune still a concern
details.content: The number of Covid-19 positive patients is going down in Maharashtra but Pune, with 3.29 lakh cumulative case, still remains at the top of the chart. (READ MORE)

details.title: 8 fresh cases in Andamans
details.content: Eight fresh COVID-19 cases reported in Andaman and Nicobar islands today, taking the total positive cases in the union territory to 4,253: UT Administration

details.title: Bengal bids adieu to Goddess Durga with the hope for a Corona-free world
details.content: As chants of 'asche bochor abar hobe.....bolo Durga Mai ki Jai (Untill next year...Hail Goddess Durga) filled the air, women, clad in the traditional attire, smeared each other with vermilion and danced to the tunes of the drum beats. (Photo | Sunish P Surendran)

details.title: Doctors in Delhi to hold protest today
details.content: Doctors from various government hospitals including Maulana Azad Medical College, Safdarjung Hospital and RML Hospital, to hold a two-hour symbolic protest today over non-payment of salary to doctors of Hindu Rao Hospital.

details.title: Healthoptim: Check out app to assess vulnerability of user to COVID-19
details.content: Healthoptim, a mobile app that serves as a digital preventive healthcare platform, has introduced a new feature that measures the user’s vulnerability to Covid. (READ MORE)
